newsitem.title: SPAIN: Caja Cataluna buys 3 pct of Repsol for 56 bln ptas.
newsitem.headline: Caja Cataluna buys 3 pct of Repsol for 56 bln ptas.

text.p: Catalan regional savings bank Caja de Cataluna has acquired 3.04 percent of Spanish energy group Repsol for 56 billion pesetas, a spokesman told Reuters on Thursday.
The spokesman said the savings bank did not intend to buy more stock in the firm.
The stake was purchased purely as a financial investment.
"With the extra cash that we have we have looked for financial investments with a future, and a reasonable expectation for Repsol would be annual growth of above 10 percent," he said.

Caja de Cataluna bought most of the shares in a off-market transaction on Wednesday for a 2.58 percent stake, or 7.74 million shares at a price of 6,244.71 pesetas each, carried out by broker Ahorro Corporacion Financiera in Barcelona.
Banco Bilbao Vizcaya has around seven percent of Repsol, as has Catalan regional savings bank La Caixa. Mexico's Pemex has five percent and Basque regional savings bank Kutxa has around 1.5 percent.
